title: Valencian Community
summary: The Valencian Community (Valencian: Comunitat Valenciana, Spanish: Comunidad Valenciana),[lower-alpha 1] or simply Valencia (Valencian: València, Spanish: Valencia),[lower-alpha 2] is an autonomous community of Spain. It is the fourth most populous Spanish autonomous community after Andalusia, Catalonia and Madrid with more than five million inhabitants.[2][3] Its homonymous capital Valencia is the third largest city and metropolitan area in Spain. It is located along the Mediterranean coast on the east side of the Iberian Peninsula. It borders with Catalonia to the north, Aragon and Castilla–La Mancha to the west, and Murcia to the south. The Valencian Community consists of three provinces which are Castellon, Valencia and Alicante.
